name: Archive or Delete a User
title: Archive or Delete a User
body:
When it comes to managing users who should no longer be in your console, you can archive or delete them. If you archive a user, you'll have the option to still include them in reports. You can also restore an archived user as if they were never removed from the console. Deleting a user permanently removes them and all of their phishing and training history from your console.

Important: To archive or delete an admin, you'll need to remove the user's admin functions first. For more information, see our How to Assign and Remove Admin Functions from a User article.

Manually Archiving a User

Archiving a user will remove them from your console, but you can unarchive them at any time. Archived users won't receive any phishing tests or training from training campaigns. Archiving a user will also prevent them from being counted in your licensed seats.

You can manually archive users individually, or you can archive one or more users. The steps for both of these options are listed in the below subsections.

Option 1: Individually 

To manually archive users individually, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to the Users tab, then select the Users subtab.
  2. From the list, find the user you would like to archive.
  3. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired user and select Archive.

Option 2: One or More Users 

To manually archive one or more users, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to the Users tab, then select the Users subtab.
  2. Select the check box to the left of the user or users you would like to archive.
  3. From the menu bar that appears above the user list, click the Archive button.

Bulk Archiving with a CSV File

If you would like to archive multiple users from the console, we recommend using the Bulk Archive option. This option will allow you to bulk archive users with a CSV file. To bulk archive users with a CSV file, follow the steps below:

  1. Create a CSV file with an Email column. In this column, enter the email addresses of the users you would like to bulk archive.
    Important: The CSV file should only include the Email field. To successfully bulk archive the users, don't include additional fields such as First Name or Last Name.
  2. In your KSAT console, navigate to the Users tab, then select the Users subtab.
  3. From the header of the Users List, click Bulk Archive.
  4. In the Bulk Archive Users pop-up window that opens, click Browse to select and upload your prepared CSV file.
  5. Select who you wish to notify of these changes.
    Tip: You can also choose to send a notification to yourself by selecting the corresponding check box.
  6. When you're ready, click Archive to archive the users from the CSV file.

Restoring an Archived User

You can restore an archived user to add them back to your user list. This will also restore their phishing and training history.

View the archived users by clicking the Status drop-down menu above the user list and selecting Archived.

You can manually restore users individually, or you can restore one or more users. The steps for both of these options are listed in the below subsections.

Option 1: Individually 

To manually restore users individually, follow the steps below: 

  1. From the Archived user list, find the user you would like to restore.
  2. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired user and select Restore.

Option 2: One or More Users 

To manually restore one or more users, follow the steps below:

  1. From the Archived user list, find the user or users you would like to restore.
  2. Select the check box next to the user or users you would like to restore.
  3. From the menu bar that appears above the user list, click the Restore button.

Bulk Restoring with a CSV File

You can restore archived users in bulk with a CSV file. To restore users in bulk, follow the steps below:

  1. Create a CSV file with an Email column. In this column, enter the email addresses of the users you would like to restore. If you don’t have a CSV file, you can download one of our sample CSV files from your KnowBe4 console. For more information, see our How to Import Users with a CSV File article.
  2. In your KnowBe4 console, navigate to Users > Import Users > CSV Import.
  3. Click the Browse button and select your CSV file.
  4. You can optionally notify console admins about the CSV file import by selecting them from the drop-down menu. Once you have updated your settings, click the Import Users button at the bottom of the page.
Important:Any email addresses in the CSV file not currently affiliated with an archived user will be imported into your console as a new user. To prevent duplicate or new users from being created, ensure that the email addresses in your CSV file match those of the archived users you want to restore.

Manually Deleting a User

You can delete users to permanently remove them from your console. Every record of the user,including all phishing and training history, will be deleted.

To delete a user, you will need to archive them first following the steps in the above sections. You can view the archived users by clicking the Status drop-down menu above the user list and selecting Archived.

You can manually delete users individually, or you can delete one or more users. The steps for both of these options are listed in the below subsections.

Option 1: Individually

To manually delete users individually, follow the steps below:

  1. From the Archived user list, find the user you would like to delete.
  2. Under the Actions column, click the drop-down arrow of the desired user and select Delete.

Option 2: One or More Users 

To manually delete one or more users, follow the steps below:

  1. From the Archived user list, find the user or users you would like to delete.
  2. Select the check box to the left of the user or users you'd like to delete.
  3. From the menu bar that appears above the user list, click the Delete button.

Bulk Deleting with a CSV File

You can delete users to permanently remove them from your console. Every record of the user, including all phishing and training history, will be deleted.

To delete a user, you will need to archive them first following the steps in the above sections. You can view the archived users by clicking the Status drop-down menu above the user list and selecting Archived.

To bulk delete using a CSV file, follow the steps below:

  1. Create a CSV file with two columns. For the first column, use the header Email. For the second column, use the header Full Delete.
  2. Using one row for each user, enter a user's email address. Then, enter "true" in the Full Delete column. Repeat this step for each user you would like to delete and then save the CSV file.
  3. Navigate to archived users by clicking the Status drop-down menu and selecting Archived.
  4. From the header of the Users List, click Bulk Delete.
  5. In the Bulk Delete Users pop-up window that opens, click Browse to select and upload your prepared CSV file.
  6. Select who you wish to notify of these changes.
    Tip: You can also choose to send a notification to yourself by selecting the corresponding check box.
  7. When you're ready, click Delete to delete the users from the CSV file.

Reimporting a Deleted User

Users who have been deleted must be reimported into your console. Use the Quick Import function to add them again. You cannot restore the phishing and training history of a previously deleted user.

images.alt:
This interface displays the user management dashboard, headed by the title **"Manage Users"** (preceded by a user icon).

**Navigation Tabs (Module Context):**
A horizontal tab navigation bar is present, with the **"Users"** tab active. Inactive tabs include **"Groups," "Import Users," "Provisioning," "Merge Users,"** and **"Security Roles."**

**Action Bar (Highlighted Functions):**
Located directly below the tabs is an action bar for bulk operations:
1.  **Selected Counter:** A static input field labeled **"Selected Users"** displays a numerical badge **(1)**, indicating the current count of selected records.
2.  **Archive Button (Focus Area):** A prominent red button, visually highlighted, displays an archive/trashcan icon followed by the text **"Archive."**
3.  **Group Management:** A dropdown menu labeled **"Select option"** is paired with a blue action button labeled **"Add to Groups."**

**Filter and Utility Row:**
The bottom row contains filtering controls and utility links:
*   **Filters:** Status: **Active** (Dropdown), Type: **All** (Dropdown), and Groups: **All** (Dropdown).
*   **Utility Links:** A link labeled **"Bulk Archive"** (with an archive icon) and a link labeled **"Download CSV"** (with a green download icon).
*   **Search/Settings:** A search input field placeholder reads **"Search by email or name...,"** accompanied by a magnifying glass icon. A gear/cog icon dropdown button is positioned on the far right for configuration options.

images.alt:
This screenshot displays the **"Manage Users"** administrative interface.

**Top Navigation and Actions:**
The primary title is **"Manage Users."** A primary action button, **"Add Users"** (with a dropdown), is located in the top-right corner.

**Sub-Navigation:**
A row of sub-navigation tabs is present. The **"Users"** tab is active (selected). Other available tabs include: "Groups," "Import Users," "Provisioning," "Merge Users," "Messages," and "Security Roles."

**Filtering and Utility Bar:**
Filters above the data table include dropdown selectors for: **"Status: Active," "Type: All,"** and **"Groups: All."** Bulk actions are available via hyperlinks: **"Bulk Archive"** and **"Generate CSV."** A search component allows input via **"Search by email or name..."** and includes Search and Settings (gear) icons.

**Data Table Structure:**
The interface presents user data in a sortable table. Column headers (all sortable via up/down arrows unless noted) are:
*   User (Includes a selection checkbox, email, and full name)
*   PPP
*   Risk
*   Location
*   Groups
*   Joined on
*   Last Login
*   Actions (Dropdown menu)

**Data Content Example:**
The third row is highlighted (in light blue) and selected via a checkbox. This entry corresponds to **"admin@kb4-demo.com / Aaron Anderson"** and displays values: PPP **100%**, Risk **10.3**, and an extensive list of Groups (including IT, Accounting, and Justice League). The Joined on and Last Login dates are **06/21/2022** and **12/21/2022**, respectively.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface segment focused on data filtering within a list or grid view.

**UI Elements and Context:**

1.  **Filter Controls:** The top row contains two visible filter controls:
    *   **Status:** Bold label followed by the currently selected value `Active` with a downward chevron dropdown indicator.
    *   **Type:** Bold label followed by the selected value `All` with a downward chevron dropdown indicator.
2.  **Active Dropdown Menu:** A white pop-up menu is displayed immediately below the "Status" filter, indicating user interaction (click/tap) on the "Status: Active" control.
    *   The menu contains two primary options: `Active` and `Archived`.
    *   The `Archived` option is highlighted with a light gray background, suggesting it is currently hovered over or selected.
3.  **Underlying Data Grid:** The background reveals elements of the filtered data set, including:
    *   Two empty, square selection checkboxes (one per row).
    *   Partial text and an associated icon (a blue Windows logo) on a data row: `Fritz.Connell@kb4-d...` (likely a user identifier or email address).
images.context: Status drop-down menu above the user list and selecting Archived.

images.alt:
This is a detailed description of a user management UI segment, focusing on bulk actions, filtering, and table headers.

**Top Row (Bulk Actions):**
1.  **Selected Users Indicator:** A text input field labeled "Selected Users" displays a blue badge with the numeral **1**, indicating one user is currently selected for bulk action.
2.  **Restore Button (Primary Action):** A prominent **Green** button, highlighted with an **Orange** selection border, labeled **Restore** and accompanied by a counter-clockwise arrow icon (refresh/restore icon).
3.  **Delete Button (Secondary Action):** A **Red** button labeled **Delete** and accompanied by a trash can icon.
4.  **Group Assignment:** A dropdown menu placeholder reads "Select option," followed by a **Blue** button labeled **Add to Groups**.

**Middle Section (Filters and Utilities):**
1.  **Filters:** Text labels indicate active filters: **Status: Archived**, **Type: All**, and **Groups: All**. Each value is a dropdown menu.
2.  **Utility Links:** Two adjacent text links:
    *   **Bulk Delete** (blue with a trash can icon).
    *   **Download CSV** (green with a download icon).
3.  **Search Bar:** A white input field with the placeholder text "Search by email or name..." A magnifying glass icon serves as the search trigger.
4.  **Settings Dropdown:** A gear icon in a separate button functions as a settings or configuration dropdown trigger.

**Bottom Row (Table Headers):**
The visible headers for the user table are:
*   An empty checkbox (for bulk selection).
*   **User** (sortable, indicated by up/down arrows).
*   **PPP** (sortable).
*   **Risk** (sortable).
*   **Groups** (non-sortable).
*   **Joined on** (sortable).
*   **Last Sign-In** (non-sortable).
*   **Actions** (non-sortable).

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface segment focused on data import via CSV.

**UI Context and Navigation:**
A segmented control/toggle interface is present at the top, indicating two import modes:
1.  **Quick Import** (Inactive/Deselected).
2.  **CSV Import** (Active/Selected, highlighted in dark gray).

**Input Fields:**
1.  **File Upload:**
    *   **Label:** Upload a CSV file (Bold text).
    *   **Control:** A standard file upload field consisting of a text box with the placeholder "Please select a file..." and an accompanying **Browse** button on the right.
2.  **Notification Setting:**
    *   **Label:** Notify Upon Import Completion (Optional).
    *   **Control:** A multi-select or tag input field. It currently contains one selected entity/tag: **Paige Turner**, which is displayed within a pill container with a removal 'X' icon. The input field also features a clear 'X' icon and a dropdown chevron on the right for managing selections.
images.context: i>Click the Browse button and select your CSV file.

images.alt:
This is a view of a user management interface, displaying controls for bulk actions, filtering, searching, and column display customization.

**I. Bulk Action Bar (Top)**

*   **Selected Items Indicator:** A display box labeled "Selected Users" with a blue circular badge indicating a count of **1**.
*   **Action Buttons:**
    *   **Restore:** A green button with a refresh icon.
    *   **Delete:** A prominent red button with a trash can icon, visually highlighted by an orange border and shadow (indicating focus or pending action).
*   **Group Management:** A dropdown menu placeholder reads "Select option," paired with a light blue button labeled **"Add to Groups."**

**II. Filter and Utility Bar (Middle)**

*   **Filters (Dropdowns):**
    *   **Status:** Set to "Archived."
    *   **Type:** Set to "All."
    *   **Groups:** Set to "All."
*   **Utility Links:**
    *   **Bulk Delete** (blue trash can icon).
    *   **Download CSV** (green download icon).
*   **Search and Settings:**
    *   A search field with the placeholder text **"Search by email or name..."** and a search icon button.
    *   A secondary button featuring a gear icon with a dropdown arrow, suggesting settings or column customization.

**III. Table Headers (Bottom)**

The bottom section displays the beginning of a user data table, featuring the following column headers (all of which appear to be sortable, indicated by adjacent up/down arrow icons):

*   Checkbox (Bulk selection)
*   **User**
*   **PPP**
*   **Risk**
*   **Groups**
*   **Joined on**
*   **Last Sign-In**
*   **Actions**

images.alt:
The image displays a partial view of a spreadsheet interface, structured into columns A and B, and rows 1 through 4.

**Header Row (Row 1):**
*   **Column A (A1):** Labeled with the bolded text, "Email".
*   **Column B (B1):** Labeled with the bolded text, "Full Delete".

**Data Records (Rows 2–4):**
The records demonstrate a list of three distinct test email addresses paired with a boolean instruction for deletion.

*   **Row 2 (A2, B2):** Contains the email `test1@kb4u-demo.com` and the value `TRUE`.
*   **Row 3 (A3, B3):** Contains the email `test2@kb4u-demo.com` and the value `TRUE`.
*   **Row 4 (A4, B4):** Contains the email `test3@kb4u-demo.com` and the value `TRUE`.

**Context:** The data set specifies three user accounts targeted for processing, indicated by the email addresses. The corresponding `TRUE` value in the "Full Delete" column confirms that a complete deletion operation is requested for all three records.
images.context: Repeat this step for each user you would like to delete and then save the CSV file.

images.alt:
This image displays the **"Manage Users"** administrative interface, specifically focused on the user listing table under the active **"Users"** tab.

**UI Context and Navigation:**

*   **Page Title:** "Manage Users."
*   **Primary Action:** A blue button labeled "Add Users" is located in the upper right.
*   **Navigation Tabs (Selected tab bolded):** **Users**, Groups, Import Users, Provisioning, Merge Users, Messages, Security Roles.

**Control Panel (Above Data Table):**

The control panel provides filtering, bulk actions, and search functionality:

*   **Filters:** Three active filters are displayed with current selections: "Status: Active," "Type: All," and "Groups: All."
*   **Bulk Actions:** Two utility buttons are present: "Bulk Archive" and "Generate CSV."
*   **Search/Settings:** A search input field is labeled "Search by email or name..." and is accompanied by a Search button and a Settings/Configuration dropdown menu (gear icon).

**User Data Table:**

The primary view is a sortable data table listing user accounts.

*   **Header Columns (L to R):** (Checkbox), **User** (currently sorted ascending), PPP, Risk, Location, Groups, Joined on, Last Login, Actions.
*   **User Data Format:** The "User" column displays the email address (blue text) on the first line and the full name on the second line. Icons, such as the Windows OS logo, precede the email address.
*   **Highlighted Row:** The user entry for "admin@kb4-demo.com / Aaron Anderson" is highlighted in light blue. This user displays an elevated PPP score (100%) and features small administrative icons (a silhouette and a lock/key) next to the email.
*   **Data Example (Highlighted Row):** PPP is 100%, Risk is 10.3, Location is absent, Groups lists multiple entries (e.g., IT, Accounting, Production), Joined on is 06/21/2022, and Last Login is 12/21/2022.
*   **Actions Column:** A dropdown caret in the "Actions" column allows for user-specific management options.
images.context: When you're ready, click Delete to delete the users from the CSV file.
